Trying to display columns inside the Common Navigator causes errors (detailed below).

The Common Navigator Framework (CNF) uses the class "CommonViewer" which extends the TreeViewer. In general, the TreeViewer class now supports using an ITableLabelProvider as the label provider, to be able to show columns in the TreeViewer (the TableTreeViewer has been deprecated, as seen in the 3.3 documentation).

However, trying to use an ITableLabelProvider as the label provider with the Common Navigator causes a ClassCastException, since it expects an ILabelProvider. The exception comes from NavigatorContentDescriptor.java. The first few lines of the exception are pasted below:

java.lang.ClassCastException: com.rbk.cnftest.navigator.FileTreeLabelProvider
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.navigator.extensions.NavigatorContentDescriptor.createLabelProvider(NavigatorContentDescriptor.java:306)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.navigator.extensions.NavigatorContentExtension.getLabelProvider(NavigatorContentExtension.java:174)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.navigator.NavigatorContentServiceLabelProvider.findUpdateLabel(NavigatorContentServiceLabelProvider.java:321)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.navigator.NavigatorContentServiceLabelProvider.updateLabel(NavigatorContentServiceLabelProvider.java:309)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.DecoratingLabelProvider.updateLabel(DecoratingLabelProvider.java:345)

Basically, we were considering using the CNF (in our product) because we want to be able to have different content and label providers based on the object that is being expanded. So we would have some top-level nodes, and depending on what they represent, expanding them would go to the corresponding label and content providers. CNF supports this using the contentExtensions and triggerPoints. It would also be possible that someone contributes a new contentExtension later with its own content and label providers. So, ideally there needs to be a way to do this from the extension points.
